subject: Re: [junit] Re: HOW TO ASK QUESTIONS ON THIS GROUP - FAQ   proposal
msgSnippet: I think there is a definite advantage to a static email being sent as the first message one receives on the list. A Wiki or similar is not a bad idea by
messageBody:
I think there is a definite advantage to a static email being sent as the
first message one receives on the list. A Wiki or similar is not a bad
idea by itself, however. We could balance toward a short static fact which
describes critical resources and refers immediately to a dynamic system.
This would raise the chances of the FAQ remaining up to date.

On 16 Oct 2001, Vladimir Bossicard wrote:

> > Here's my proposal for a list of topics; I can already see various items
> > that I can't answer (I don't do extreme programming, I don't use an ide...)
>
> The FAQ is an excellent idea but instead of having a static email, why do not set up a wiki project?
>
> The challenge will be to keep this reference up-to-date and make this project last longer than a few weeks...
>
> -Vladimir
>
>
